scenario_text.value: Hey, Takuma.
What?
You really believe in Miyuki, right?

I do. We’ll get her back to normal, no matter
what. And then we’re all going home.
You’re something else, man...

I don’t think I can believe in Miyuki that
much.
But Miyuki is one of us, isn’t she?
Yeah!

I know that, it’s just... She ended up
turning on us, and attacked us so many times.

Are you sure she hasn’t been swallowed up by
the Master?

(I want to say yes, but I don’t have any
proof of that at the moment.)

(But it isn’t about proof, is it? We can’t
save Miyuki if we don’t believe in her.)

(She’s being manipulated, but even so,
Miyuki’s still alive. I’m sure he gets that.)
(What should I say to Minoru?)
She’s not gone yet.
We gotta believe.
I’m sure you get it.

Miyuki isn’t gone yet. We’ll rescue her for
sure.
Sure, I don’t have any proof, but...

Ha ha, not even a little? Naw, nothing like
that would exist, would it?

We have to believe that we can save Miyuki.
We can’t do it unless we believe.

Yeah, that’s true... No use worrying over
this, that and the other thing now.

You get it, don’t you, Minoru? Miyuki’s still
alive, even if the Master is controlling her.

The professor’s voice reached her, after all.
I’m sure our voices will reach her, too.
Yeah...I guess you’re right.

Well, if you’re that sure of things, then
that’s what I believe is going to happen too.
Minoru...

I mean, let’s not get carried away here! That
may not be how things go down. Just maybe.

Minoru, do not speak such a meaningless
falsehood. You truly believe in that girl.

Hey, shut up! It’s Takuma who I trust, and
even then, there’s no guarantee, okay?!

Well, I appreciate it either way. I’m glad
you believe in what we’re doing.

If we run into Miyuki again, I’ll try talking
to her.

She may not listen to what I have to say, but
I won’t rush into a fight.

That is good. Your resolve is admirable,
Minoru.

Ugh, I always get so embarrassed when you
compliment me, Falcomon.

Thank you. I’m sure Miyuki will appreciate
that, too.

Yeah. That’s something else I choose to
believe.

My bad, Takuma. I lost my nerve there for
a second. I’m okay now, for really real.
